rawtext.translate: Great work, the garden is 24 across and I am halfway along. So using the 12 rod is exactly right. Thank you for saving me.
You saved me! However, you made up a half out of multiple fractions. I can show you a more optimum way.
Help me! You can only rescue me if you use the right amount of rods to get to this platform, otherwise I can't get back safely. If you need to start again talk to the Prof.
You saved me! 12 is half of 24 and you used the right rod to get here.
Well done, you made it! But there is a more optimum route to get here, can I show you?
Help me! You can only rescue me if you use the right amount of rods to get to this platform, otherwise I can't get back safely. If you need to start again talk to the Prof.
You saved me! 4 is a sixth of 24 and you used the right rod to get here.
Well done, you made it! But there is a more optimum route to get here, can I show you?
Help me! You can only rescue me if you use the right amount of rods to get to this platform, otherwise I can't get back safely. If you need to start again talk to the Prof.
Great work you made ¾ in the most optimum way by combining  ½ and ¼ .
Well done, you made it! But there is a more optimum route to get here, can I show you?
Help me! You can only rescue me if you use the right amount of rods to get to this platform, otherwise I can't get back safely. If you need to start again talk to the Prof.
Well done! You combined ¼ with 1/8 to make 3/8.
Well done, you made it! But there is a more optimum route to get here, can I show you?
Help me! You can only rescue me if you use the right amount of rods to get to this platform, otherwise I can't get back safely. If you need to start again talk to the Prof.
Wow, great working going over 1 tweed.
Well done, you made it! But there is a more optimum route to get here, can I show you?
Help me! You can only rescue me if you use the right amount of rods to get to this platform, otherwise I can't get back safely. If you need to start again talk to the Prof.
Well done, you made it! But there is a more optimum route to get here, can I show you?
Help me! You can only rescue me if you use the right amount of rods to get to this platform, otherwise I can't get back safely. If you need to start again talk to the Prof.
You saved me! 3 is indeed 1/8 of 24, you used the right rod.
Well done, you made it! But there is a more optimum route to get here, can I show you?
Help me! You can only rescue me if you use the right amount of rods to get to this platform, otherwise I can't get back safely. If you need to start again talk to the Prof.
You’ve completed the game and saved all the students. Great work.
Well done, you made it! But there is a more optimum route to get here, can I show you?
Thanks for rescuing me, wait I didn’t need rescuing!!!
Help me! You can only rescue me if you use the right amount of rods to get to this platform, otherwise I can't get back safely. If you need to start again talk to the Prof.
Welcome! We need your help with three different maths challenges. Pick one below, then a Professor from that school will guide you from the courtyard ahead.
This old building desperately needs some new windows. The architecture team needs the help of a Mathmogician to scale it correctly. Follow me!

Take this stained glass and make a design using the smaller frames here. 

Once your design is ready, click the numerator to increase the amount the window needs to be scaled. 

Then right click the fraction bar to scale the window.

1. Place the stained glass in the frames. 
2. Left click the numerator (top number) with the wand to change it.
3. Right click the fraction bar to make the window appear. 
4. If you’ve made a mistake left click the fraction bar to make it disappear.
I hear you want to take on the Well diving championship, very well, follow me.
The challenge awaits, please keep up.

Mmmm delicious, okay lets get some coins.

The ratios for the potions you’ll need are on the wall. 

To make a potion mix it in the cauldron and tap it with your wand.

Here are the steps for the game. 
1. Check the ratios on the wall.
2. Chuck the ingredients in the cauldron to the correct ratio.
3. Click on the cauldron with your wand.
4. Check the bar chart to see if your ratios are correct. 
5. If they are correct, drink the potion and dive in the well. 
6. Remember to follow the rules and click on the coins to gather them.
You broke rule number 2, you must let the potions do the work, no swimming or diving.

Before we start I need you to make me a .... I mean teach you about ratios, by making me chocolate milk. 

Put 2 parts Cocoa beans to 1 part Milk into the cauldron and tap it with your wand.

Eurghhhh that is not right, 

You need to put 2 parts cocoa to 1 part milk.
This is embarrassing, I’ve lost my cartography students in the walled gardens (yes I know). Please help me! Follow me to the gardens.
Oh dear oh dear, please keep up I cannot lose a whole class.

I need you to rescue each student that is trapped.  Use these magical rods to reach each student. 

If you need to start again or get stuck come back to me!

1. The grids are 24x24 blocks wide and you need to use the rods to cross them.
2. You can place the rods by right clicking in front of the white blocks. 
3. Talk to each student as you go, they will let you know if you have placed the most optimum rod down.
Well done you saved the student and made it to a checkpoint. Come back to me if you run out of rods.

Getting more rods will reset the game. 

Are you sure you want to reset the game?
